intro: Ruellia amplexicaulis, commonly known as the clasping ruellia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, ovate leaves that often wrap around the stems. The plant produces showy blue or purple flowers in clusters, which bloom from summer to fall. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sun. Ruellia amplexicaulis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its attractive foliage and vibrant blooms.
